Booked Out podcast

Booked Out is our monthly book recommendation podcast, from Woodbridge Libraryâ€™s Kellie Dimmock, Richard Baker, Sheila Haskins and Sophie Green.
  • March 2016: Local authors, local heroes

    Written by the Booked Out team on Mar 1, 2016

    Sheila and guests discuss their favourite local authors including Ruth Dugdall and Delia Smith and featuring special guest star, author Robin Herne.

  • February 2016: Under the radar

    Written by the Booked Out team on Feb 1, 2016

    Sophie and guests discuss recommended titles in international fiction including: Neverhome by Laird Hunt; A Heart so White by Javier Marias; Don't Let's Go to the Dogs Tonight by Alexandra Fuller; Novel 11, Book 18 by Dag Solstad and Snow by Orhan Pamuk.

  • January 2016: Books that have made a difference

    Written by the Booked Out team on Jan 1, 2016

    Kellie and guests discuss titles that have changed their lives including; Threads: the Delicate Life of John Craske by Julia Blackburn, No Surrender by Constance Maud, Nella Last's War: the second World War Diaries of housewife 49 by Nella Last ,and The Little Grey Men by BB.

  • December 2015: Best of 2015

    Written by the Booked Out team on Dec 1, 2015

    Sophie and guests discuss the most borrowed titles of 2015 plus some recommendations from library staff and customers including The Girl on the Train by Paula Hawkins, Go Set a Watchman by Harper Lee, H is for Hawk by Helen Macdonald and Save with Jamie by Jamie Oliver.

  • November 2015: Judging books by their covers

    Written by the Booked Out team on Nov 1, 2015

    Sheila and guests discuss how, why and whether or not we should be judging books by their covers. Titles discussed include Northanger Abbey by Val McDermid, The Betrayers by David Bezmozgis and Little Failure by Gary Shteyngart.

  • October 2015: Noir

    Written by the Booked Out team on Oct 1, 2015

    Sophie and guests discuss Noir in print, film and television titles available from Suffolk Libraries including Deep Water by Patricia Highsmith, The Spirit by Will Eisner, True Detective, Chinatown, L.A. Confidential, The Killing, The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo by Steig Larsson and Frank Miller's Sin City.

  • September 2015: The natural world

    Written by the Booked Out team on Sep 1, 2015

    Kellie and guests discuss best recommended Natural History books including Badgerlands by Patrick Barkham, Meadowland: the private life of an English field by John Lewis-Stempel, Wildlings: The Secret Garden of Eileen Soper, My First Summer in the Sierra by John Muir, Wild Places by Robert Macfarlane, Last Chance to See by Douglas Adams and Mark Carwardine, and Humble by Nature by Kate Humble.

  • August 2015: Best of children's fiction

    Written by the Booked Out team on Aug 1, 2015

    Sophie and guests recommend children and YA fiction titles for all ages including Buffalo Soldier by Tanya Landman, Swallows and Amazons by Arthur Ransome, Wonder by R.J. Palacio, Looking for Alaska by John Green, picture books by Emma Chichester Clark and Rebecca Cobb, and series including Erin Hunter's Warrior Cats, Adventure Island by Helen Moss, iHorror (Pick your path) by Steve Barlow and Steve Skidmore, and the Naruto Manga by Masahai Kishimoto.

  • July 2015: Books in translation

    Written by the Booked Out team on Jul 1, 2015

    Richard and guests discuss recommended titles of translated fiction including Miss Smilla's Feeling for Snow by Peter Hoeg, The letter for the King by Tonke Dragt, Out Stealing Horses by Per Petterson, The Dead Lake by Hamid Ismailov, and The Ghost Rider by Ismail Kadare.

  • June 2015: Brave New Reads

    Written by the Booked Out team on Jun 1, 2015

    Sophie Green and guests discuss the six titles selected as Brave New Reads for 2015: The Dead Lake by Hamid Ismailov, Fallen Land by Patrick Flanery, Black Country by Liz Berry, Any Other Mouth by Anneliese Mackintosh, Badgerlands by Patrick Barkham and Prayers for the Stolen by Jennifer Clements.

  • May 2015: Cookery books

    Written by the Booked Out team on May 1, 2015

    Kellie and guests discuss their favourite cooks and cookery books including Sous Chef: 24 Hours in the Kitchen by Michael Gibney, Eat: The Little Book of Fast Food by Nigel Slater, Nigella Lawson's How to be a Domestic Goddess and James Martin's Great British Winter Cookbook.

  • April 2015: Lucky dip

    Written by the Booked Out team on Apr 1, 2015

    In this improvised 'Lucky Dip' edition, Sheila and guests review a random selection of titles and explore the art of judging books by their covers. Books discussed include Little Women by Louisa M Alcott, Fahrenheit 451 by Ray Bradbury, The Little Old Lady who Struck Lucky Again by Catharina Ingelman-Sundberg, When I was a Nipper by Alan Titchmarsh and Kenneth Grahame: An Innocent in the Wild Wood by Alison Prince.

  • March 2015: Irish writers

    Written by the Booked Out team on Mar 1, 2015

    Irish Writers. In celebration of St. Patrick's Day, Sophie Green and guests discuss titles by Irish Writers available through Suffolk Libraries including Amongst Women by John McGahern, History of the Rain by Niall Williams, Nora Webster by Colm Toibin and The Butcher Boy by Patrick McCabe.

  • February 2015: Love is in the air

    Written by the Booked Out team on Mar 1, 2015

    Love is in the Air. Kellie Dimmock and guests discuss Romance in titles available through Suffolk Libraries including North and South by Elizabeth Gaskell, Uncommon Arrangements by Katie Roiphe, Love Lessons by Joan Wynham, Vivien's Heavenly Ice Cream Shop by Abby Clements and Fifty Shades of Grey by E.L. James

  • January 2015: Graphic novels

    Written by the Booked Out team on Mar 1, 2015

    Richard Baker and guests discuss Graphic Novels available through Suffolk Libraries including DC Comics, Minutemen/Silk Spectre, Alan Moore's V for Vendetta and Watchmen and Ordinary Victories by Manu Larcenet.
